intro: Licaria coriacea, commonly known as the rough licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded understories of forests. Licaria coriacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses in local cultures.
